data.text:
4 THE AGE Wednesday 26 November 1986 'tafos (Dm ((DirtHffiigo Varian Techtron is exporting the world's best scientific instruments to Europe and the World. This high-technology company in Muterave The Governor of Victoria Export Awards for 1986 have been won by Victorian firms whose export drives have met with astounding successes on highly-competitive world markets. The Victorian Government congratulates the four has received a Certificate of Commendation Award. Varian following winners, as well as the more than 30 firms from all around Victoria who were nominees for the Awards. PilkingtonACIof Geelong had the vision to export laminated windscreens to Japan and West Germany .

Techtron's specialised scientific instruments notably a range of atomic absorption spectrometers -are unsurpassed for quality An achievement that has seen their export earnings lift from $18 to $30 million in the last three years. Jet-Pak International Mr. Keith Fletcher, General is set to become the world's largest 7 packerexporter of fresh green asparagus. An achievement that has seen this Dalmore agricultural company also receive a Certificate of Manager, Automotive Glass Division has won the Individual Award for 1986. In a real "coals to Newcastle" success story, Keith Fletcher raised and maintained high-quality standards, installed Commendation .

Jet-Pack grows its asparagus solely for export, and has achieved a very high-quality high-technology glass processing equipment and set up skilled training for local clearing the way for this Geelong-based company rJ) MM MM MM product by using some of the world's most advanced agricultural technology So proficient are Jet-Pak that within 48 hours of to export automotive glass products to two countries that lead the world in automotive technology Bendix-Mintex Pty. Ltd. of Ballarat had the disc brake pads that stopped the American import car market. This is an export achievement ft picking, their asparagus is on the tables in Japan. that has seen Bendix-Mintex win the I A I Company Award for 1986 .

Committed to a high-quality product, and against the odds, this Ballarat companv is How the Victorian Government can help Victorian firms to export successfully. Your company too, can be an Export winner. The Victorian Government's ten-year Economic Strategy is firmly committed to assisting Victorian firms secure new exports. a full range of replacement pads and custom packaging for North America. Bendix-Mintex has been producing automotive friction materials for the past thirty years. It is the largest such manufacturer in Australia and employs 450 people at its Ballarat manufacturing plant and headquarters. A progress report onVictom's Economic Strategy .
